documentation.text: @dev safeApprove (like approve) should only be called when setting an initial allowance or when resetting it to zero; otherwise prefer safeIncreaseAllowance and safeDecreaseAllowance

@title Safe ERC20 interaction library
 @dev derived from https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/ (MIT license)

@title utility functions for uint256 operations
 @dev derived from https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/ (MIT license)

Smart contract library of mathematical functions operating with signed
 64.64-bit fixed point numbers.  Signed 64.64-bit fixed point number is
 basically a simple fraction whose numerator is signed 128-bit integer and
 denominator is 2^64.  As long as denominator is always the same, there is no
 need to store it, thus in Solidity signed 64.64-bit fixed point numbers are
 represented by int128 type holding only the numerator.
@dev Interface of the OFT standard

@dev estimate send token `tokenId` to (`dstChainId`, `toAddress`)
 dstChainId - L0 defined chain id to send tokens too
 toAddress - dynamic bytes array which contains the address to whom you are sending tokens to on the dstChain
 amount - amount of the tokens to transfer
 useZro - indicates to use zro to pay L0 fees
 adapterParam - flexible bytes array to indicate messaging adapter services in L0

@dev send `amount` amount of token to (`dstChainId`, `toAddress`) from `from`
 `from` the owner of token
 `dstChainId` the destination chain identifier
 `toAddress` can be any size depending on the `dstChainId`.
 `amount` the quantity of tokens in wei
 `refundAddress` the address LayerZero refunds if too much message fee is sent
 `zroPaymentAddress` set to address(0x0) if not paying in ZRO (LayerZero Token)
 `adapterParams` is a flexible bytes array to indicate messaging adapter services
@dev returns the circulating amount of tokens on current chain

@dev Emitted when `amount` tokens are moved from the `sender` to (`dstChainId`, `toAddress`)
 `nonce` is the outbound nonce

@dev Emitted when `amount` tokens are received from `srcChainId` into the `toAddress` on the local chain.
 `nonce` is the inbound nonce.
@dev Interface of the IOFT core standard

userdoc.notice: Smart contract library of mathematical functions operating with signed 64.64-bit fixed point numbers.  Signed 64.64-bit fixed point number is basically a simple fraction whose numerator is signed 128-bit integer and denominator is 2^64.  As long as denominator is always the same, there is no need to store it, thus in Solidity signed 64.64-bit fixed point numbers are represented by int128 type holding only the numerator.

totalSupply().notice: query the total minted token supply

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: transfer tokens to given recipient on behalf of given holder

approve(address,uint256).details: prefer ERC20Extended functions to avoid transaction-ordering vulnerability (see https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729)

params.amount: quantity of tokens approved for spending

returns._0: success status (always true; otherwise function should revert)

circulatingSupply().details: returns the circulating amount of tokens on current chain

params.amount: quantity by which to decrease allowance

returns._0: success status (always true; otherwise function will revert)

estimateSendFee(uint16,bytes,uint256,boo.details: estimate send token `tokenId` to (`dstChainId`, `toAddress`) dstChainId - L0 defined chain id to send tokens too toAddress - dynamic bytes array which contains the address to whom you are sending tokens to on the dstChain amount - amount of the tokens to transfer useZro - indicates to use zro to pay L0 fees adapterParam - flexible bytes array to indicate messaging adapter services in L0

params.amount: quantity by which to increase allowance

returns._0: success status (always true; otherwise function will revert)

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.details: this function may be vulnerable to approval replay attacks

params.amount: quantity of tokens to approve
params.owner: holder of tokens and signer of permit

sendFrom(address,uint16,bytes,uint256,ad.details: send `amount` amount of token to (`dstChainId`, `toAddress`) from `from` `from` the owner of token `dstChainId` the destination chain identifier `toAddress` can be any size depending on the `dstChainId`. `amount` the quantity of tokens in wei `refundAddress` the address LayerZero refunds if too much message fee is sent `zroPaymentAddress` set to address(0x0) if not paying in ZRO (LayerZero Token) `adapterParams` is a flexible bytes array to indicate messaging adapter services

params.amount: quantity of tokens to transfer

returns._0: success status (always true; otherwise function should revert)

params.amount: quantity of tokens to transfer
params.holder: holder of tokens prior to transfer

returns._0: success status (always true; otherwise function should revert)

addPremiaRewards(uint256).notice: Add premia rewards to distribute. Can only be called by the owner

allocatePending(address,address,bool,uin.notice: Allocate pending rewards to a user. Only callable by the option pool

claim(address,address,bool,uint256,uint2.notice: Update user reward allocation + claim allocated PREMIA reward. Only callable by the option pool

getPremiaPerYear().notice: Get the amount of premia emitted per year

multiClaim(address,address[],bool[]).notice: Trigger reward distribution by multiple pools

pendingPremia(address,bool,address).notice: Get pending premia reward for a user on a pool

premiaRewardsAvailable().notice: Get amount of premia reward available to distribute

setPremiaPerYear(uint256).notice: Set new alloc points for an option pool. Can only be called by the owner.

updatePool(address,bool,uint256,uint256).notice: Update reward variables of the given pool to be up-to-date. Only callable by the option pool

params._isCallPool: True if for call option pool, False if for put option pool
params._totalTVL: Total amount of tokens deposited in the option pool
params._user: User for whom allocate the rewards
params._userTVLNew: Total amount of tokens deposited in the option pool by user after the allocation update
params._userTVLOld: Total amount of tokens deposited in the option pool by user before the allocation update

params._isCallPool: True if for call option pool, False if for put option pool
params._totalTVL: Total amount of tokens deposited in the option pool
params._userTVLNew: Total amount of tokens deposited in the option pool by user after the allocation update
params._userTVLOld: Total amount of tokens deposited in the option pool by user before the allocation update

params.isCallPool: whether we want infos of the CALL pool or the PUT pool

params.isCall: list of bools indicating whether each pool is call pool

params._isCallPool: True if for call option pool, False if for put option pool

returns._0: Amount of premia reward available to distribute

params._premiaPerYear: Amount of PREMIA per year to allocate as reward across all pools

params._isCallPool: True if for call option pool, False if for put option pool
params._totalTVL: Total amount of tokens deposited in the option pool

DOMAIN_SEPARATOR().notice: return the EIP-712 domain separator unique to contract and chain

addRewards(uint256).notice: add premia tokens as available tokens to be distributed as rewards

allowance(address,address).notice: query the allowance granted from given holder to given spender

approve(address,uint256).notice: grant approval to spender to spend tokens

balanceOf(address).notice: query the token balance of given account

decimals().notice: return token decimals, generally used only for display purposes

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: decrease spend amount granted to spender

earlyUnstake(uint256).notice: unstake tokens before end of the lock period, for a fee

getAvailablePremiaAmount().notice: get the amount of PREMIA available for withdrawal

getAvailableRewards().notice: get amount of tokens that have not yet been distributed as rewards

getDiscountBPS(address).notice: Calculate the % of fee discount for user, based on his stake

getEarlyUnstakeFeeBPS(address).notice: get early unstake fee for given user

getPendingRewards().notice: get pending amount of tokens to be distributed as rewards to stakers

getPendingUserRewards(address).notice: Get pending rewards amount, including pending pool update

getPendingWithdrawal(address).notice: get pending withdrawal data of a user

getTotalPower().notice: Return the total power across all users (applying the bonus from lockup period chosen)

getUserInfo(address).notice: Get staking infos of a user

getUserPower(address).notice: Calculate the stake amount of a user, after applying the bonus from the lockup period chosen

harvest().notice: Harvest rewards directly to user wallet

harvestAndStake((uint256,address,address.notice: harvest rewards, convert to PREMIA using exchange helper, and stake

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: increase spend amount granted to spender

nonces(address).notice: get the current ERC2612 nonce for the given address

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.notice: approve spender to transfer tokens held by owner via signature

stake(uint256,uint64).notice: Lockup xPremia for protocol fee discounts          Longer period of locking will apply a multiplier on the amount staked, in the fee discount calculation

startWithdraw(uint256).notice: Initiate the withdrawal process by burning xPremia, starting the delay period

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: query whether contract has registered support for given interface

totalSupply().notice: query the total minted token supply

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: transfer tokens to given recipient on behalf of given holder

params.amount: amount of premia tokens to add as rewards

approve(address,uint256).details: prefer ERC20Extended functions to avoid transaction-ordering vulnerability (see https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729)

params.amount: quantity of tokens approved for spending

returns._0: success status (always true; otherwise function should revert)

circulatingSupply().details: returns the circulating amount of tokens on current chain

params.amount: quantity by which to decrease allowance

returns._0: success status (always true; otherwise function will revert)

params.amount: the amount of vxPremia to unstake

estimateSendFee(uint16,bytes,uint256,boo.details: estimate send token `tokenId` to (`dstChainId`, `toAddress`) dstChainId - L0 defined chain id to send tokens too toAddress - dynamic bytes array which contains the address to whom you are sending tokens to on the dstChain amount - amount of the tokens to transfer useZro - indicates to use zro to pay L0 fees adapterParam - flexible bytes array to indicate messaging adapter services in L0

returns._0: amount of PREMIA available for withdrawal

returns.rewards: amount of tokens not yet distributed as rewards
returns.unstakeRewards: amount of PREMIA not yet claimed from early unstake fees

params.user: The _user for which the discount is for

returns._0: Percentage of protocol fee discount (in basis point)         Ex : 1000 = 10% fee discount

returns.feePercentage: % fee to pay for early unstake (1e4 = 100%)

returns._0: amount of tokens pending to be distributed as rewards

params.user: User for which to calculate pending rewards

returns.reward: amount of pending rewards from protocol fees (in REWARD_TOKEN)
returns.unstakeReward: amount of pending rewards from early unstake fees (in PREMIA)

returns.unlockDate: timestamp at which withdrawal becomes available

params.period: The duration (in seconds) for which tokens are locked

returns._0: The multiplier for this staking period         Ex : 20000 = x2
The total power across all users

params.user: The user address for which to get staking infos

returns._0: The staking infos of the user

params.user: The user from which to query the stake amount

returns._0: The user stake amount after applying the bonus

params.amount: quantity by which to increase allowance

returns._0: success status (always true; otherwise function will revert)

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.details: this function may be vulnerable to approval replay attacks

params.amount: quantity of tokens to approve
params.owner: holder of tokens and signer of permit

sendFrom(address,uint16,bytes,uint256,ad.details: send `amount` amount of token to (`dstChainId`, `toAddress`) from `from` `from` the owner of token `dstChainId` the destination chain identifier `toAddress` can be any size depending on the `dstChainId`. `amount` the quantity of tokens in wei `refundAddress` the address LayerZero refunds if too much message fee is sent `zroPaymentAddress` set to address(0x0) if not paying in ZRO (LayerZero Token) `adapterParams` is a flexible bytes array to indicate messaging adapter services

params.amount: The amount of xPremia to stake
The amount of xPremia to stake
params.deadline: Deadline after which permit will fail

params.amount: quantity of xPremia to unstake
quantity of tokens to transfer

returns._0: success status (always true; otherwise function should revert)

params.amount: quantity of tokens to transfer
params.holder: holder of tokens prior to transfer

returns._0: success status (always true; otherwise function should revert)

castVotes((uint256,uint8,bytes)[]).notice: add or remove votes, in the limit of the user voting power

decimals().notice: return token decimals, generally used only for display purposes

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: decrease spend amount granted to spender

earlyUnstake(uint256).notice: unstake tokens before end of the lock period, for a fee

getAvailablePremiaAmount().notice: get the amount of PREMIA available for withdrawal

getAvailableRewards().notice: get amount of tokens that have not yet been distributed as rewards

getDiscountBPS(address).notice: Calculate the % of fee discount for user, based on his stake

getEarlyUnstakeFeeBPS(address).notice: get early unstake fee for given user

getPendingRewards().notice: get pending amount of tokens to be distributed as rewards to stakers

getPendingUserRewards(address).notice: Get pending rewards amount, including pending pool update

getPendingWithdrawal(address).notice: get pending withdrawal data of a user

getPoolVotes(uint8,bytes).notice: get total votes for specific pools

getTotalPower().notice: Return the total power across all users (applying the bonus from lockup period chosen)

getUserInfo(address).notice: Get staking infos of a user

getUserPower(address).notice: Calculate the stake amount of a user, after applying the bonus from the lockup period chosen

harvest().notice: Harvest rewards directly to user wallet

harvestAndStake((uint256,address,address.notice: harvest rewards, convert to PREMIA using exchange helper, and stake

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: increase spend amount granted to spender

nonces(address).notice: get the current ERC2612 nonce for the given address

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.notice: approve spender to transfer tokens held by owner via signature

stake(uint256,uint64).notice: Lockup xPremia for protocol fee discounts          Longer period of locking will apply a multiplier on the amount staked, in the fee discount calculation

startWithdraw(uint256).notice: Initiate the withdrawal process by burning xPremia, starting the delay period

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: query whether contract has registered support for given interface

totalSupply().notice: query the total minted token supply

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: transfer tokens to given recipient on behalf of given holder

params.amount: amount of premia tokens to add as rewards
